abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Ethiopia Drought
            Recovery project was to support recovery of peasant crop and
            livestock production through increasing the Government of
            Ethiopia's capacity to cope with the draught situation
            by provisional agricultural inputs, transport and water
            supply equipment and spare parts, and technical assistance.
            In general the program was implemented satisfactorily and
            the original objectives were achieved. Some of the key
            finding were as follows: the Bank took the correct position
            by keeping the project simple, limiting financing to quick
            disbursing components, leaving long term problems to be
            tackled by other projects, and giving institutional aspects
            only secondary consideration.

abstracts.cdata!:
In general, the Ethiopia Drought
            Recovery Program was implemented satisfactorily and the
            original objectives were achieved despite delays associated
            with the procurement of 100 trucks for RRC and water supply
            equipment and spare parts. The main findings of the project
            are: in emergency projects of this nature, it is correct to
            keep the project simple by limiting it to easily manageable
            key components, with emphasis on action, and giving other
            institutional aspects only secondary consideration; and to
            accelerate the arrival of key inputs such as trucks which
            were crucial to the transport of relief materials, the
            Borrower should avail itself of the Bank's sample
            bidding documents and specifications when these are
            relevant, and the Bank should provide technical assistance
            to help the Government through the procurement process when
            the implementing agency lacks this experience.

docna.cdata!:
Ethiopia - Drought Recovery Program : Credit
            1576 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Ethiopia - Drought Recovery
            Program : Credit 1576 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

abstracts.cdata!:
The proposed program would help the
            Government to provide crucial relief and rehabilitation
            services to alleviate the impact of drought and famine on
            human welfare.  The main objectives include supporting the
            recovery of peasant crop and livestock production; enabling
            the Government to cope with the drought situation and relief
            effort, as well as reducing the fiscal and balance of
            payments impact of the drought.  To achieve these
            objectives, the program would assist three key sectors:
            agriculture, transportation, and water supply.
            Specifically, the proposed program would fund 50,000 tons of
            fertilizer and US$2.0 million worth of plant protection
            chemicals and the same value of veterinary drugs and
            equipment for boosting 1985 agricultural production by
            peasant farmers.  It would also provide about 100 four-wheel
            drive trucks for the Relief and Rehabilitation Commission,
            for transporting food from main stores to rural distribution
            centers as well as spare parts for maintaining the public
            and private truck fleet.  Furthermore, the program would
            fund water pumps, motors and generators to repair about 170
            mechanized and 800 hand-operated wells and boreholes in the
            drought areas; and two drill rigs with ancillary equipment
            for constructing potable water supplies.
